author: Movieclips
description:
On this episode of the Awards Tour podcast, Rotten Tomatoes Awards Editor Jacqueline Coley sits down with Emmy-nominated producer and actor Diego Luna to dive into his latest project, ‘Kiss of the Spider Woman.’ Luna discusses stepping into the role of Valentin Arregui, a revolutionary imprisoned alongside Luis Molina (played by Tonatiuh), and how the film’s powerful storytelling challenged him both emotionally and physically.

They also discuss Luna’s wide-ranging career, from his breakout performance with Gael García Bernal in Alfonso Cuarón’s indie classic ‘Y tu mamá también,’ to portraying another revolutionary in the wildly popular Disney+ series ‘Andor.’ Later, Luna opens up about pushing himself to sing and dance in a musical, collaborating with Jennifer Lopez, and what movies and television shows he’s watching when he’s not on set.

Check out ‘Kiss of the Spider Woman’ available now on Fandango at Home, and we’ll see you on the next stop on the awards tour.

► Learn more: http
title: Diego Luna Talks ‘Kiss of the Spider Woman,’ ‘Andor,’ and Playing Revolutionaries
